goal_descEN: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
target_descEN: Develop and implement tools to monitor sustainable development impacts for sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products

seriesDescription: Implementation of standard accounting tools to monitor the economic and environmental aspects of tourism (SEEA tables)
geoAreaName: China, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region
footnotes:
Inbound tourism "consumption" (instead of "expenditure") is included in the TSA Table. This is slightly different from the "total tourism expenditure associated to inbound tourism" released by the Hong Kong Tourism Board because the estimated visitors' expenditures on departure tax and on services not directly provided by resident producers are not included in the "inbound tourism consumption". 
Main aggregates on residents' expenditure abroad (REA) are available in national account statistics
Main aggregates on gross output (at basic prices), intermediate consumption (at purchasers' prices), value added (at basic prices), compensation of employees, other taxes less subsidies on production, gross operating surplus by selected tourism industries and other industries are available in national accounts statistics.
Tourism ratios for selected tourism products and selected tourism industries are available in TSA Table. Main aggregates on gross output (at basic prices), intermediate consumption (at purchasers' prices), value added (at basic prices), compensation of employees, other taxes less subsidies on production, gross operating surplus by selected tourism industries and other industries are available in national accounts statistics.
Employment numbers pertaining to the part provided to visitors by industries on retail trade, accommodation services, food and beverage services, transport services and other personal services are available.
A similar "Overall Energy Balance", which is not exactly the same as "SEEA physical flow accounts for energy", is used.
sources: Census and Statistics Department, HKSAR

But it is planned to implement TSA in the near future by this ministry in collaboration with other organizations such as the Statistical Center of Iran and Central Bank of the Islamic Republic of Iran. footnotes: ["Ireland does not currently compile any TSA tables. The air emission and energy flow accounts arise from an EU Environmental Accounts Regulation - Regulation 538/2014 amending 691/2011\nIreland has sent both to Eurostat and published the air accounts nationally https://www.cso.ie/en/statistics/environmentaccounts/environmentalaccountsairemissions/. Ireland hasn't published the energy accounts nationally because they would be quite similar to the SEAI energy balances and to the CSO Business Energy Use survey https://www.cso.ie/en/statistics/climateandenergy/businessenergyuse/. Eurostat has published both modules https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/environment/air-emissions and https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/environment/energy-accounts including data for Ireland"]
sources: The air emission figures are based on the air emissions inventories submitted annually by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to the United Nations under the UNFCCC (United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change) and under the CLRTAP (Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution)

Links for database and metadata: \nhttps://data.stat.gov.rs/Home/Result/25040102?languageCode=en-US / https://data.stat.gov.rs/Home/Result/25040101?languageCode=en-US

goal_descEN: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
target_descEN: Develop and implement tools to monitor sustainable development impacts for sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products
indicator_descEN: Number of sustainable tourism strategies or policies and implemented action plans with agreed monitoring and evaluation tools
seriesDescription: Implementation of standard accounting tools to monitor the economic and environmental aspects of tourism (SEEA tables)
footnotes:
The Agency for Statistics of BiH did not compile satellite accounts for tourism. Agency for statistics of BiH has a plan to stat with the development of TSA in BiH through next IPA 2019 Twinning project. BHAS is currently producing only accommodation statistics. In 2019 BHAS introduced new regular survey on demand-side tourism statistics in BiH in accordance with EU Regulation 692/2011, Annex II National Tourism. The new survey on private and business trips of resident population in BiH gather data on national tourism, that is, the data on the number and characteristics of travels of the BiH population outside their usual environment and on the same-day visits. Eurostat has been developing and promoting environmental-economic accounts for several years using the SEEA Central Framework 2012. Regulation (EU) No 691/2011 on European environmental economic accounts aims to establish a set of environmental accounts. 
There are two waves of accounts. A first wave of accounts comprises environmental taxes, air emissions accounts and economy-wide material flow accounts. A second wave of accounts comprises environmental goods and services sector accounts, environmental protection expenditure accounts and physical energy flow accounts. Handbooks, manuals, questionnaires and compilation guidelines exist for all these accounts.
Through IPA 2017 Multi-beneficiary Statistical Cooperation Programme, Agency for statistics of BiH implemented pilot project 5.5 Environmental accounts.
1. Objectives of the project
Set up and start transmitting estimates to Eurostat for the first set of accounts established in Regulation 691/2011, primarly air emission accounts (AEA), environmental taxes (ETEA) and economy-wide material flow accounts (EW-MFA) for BA. 
So far BA has no activities with regard to air emission accounts (AEA), but considers the development of this account both possible and realistic, since the greenhouse gas (GHG) inventory is well developed, available and a perfect basis to achieve results for SEEA Air Emission Accounts. UNDP BA has supported the implementation of a national inventory and produced four reports for BA following UNFCCC formats, with time series for 1990 â 2014.
sources: Agency for Statistics of Bosnia and Herzegovina

footnotes: Currently, we are working on revision of TSA 2013-2017, therefore the availability of the date will be changed to 2013-2017, except for: TSA-Table 7: prior to 2008-2017.\nFrom four SEEA physical flow accounts we have implemented on national level two accounts: account for energy (PEFA) and accounts for air emissions (AEA), which are obligatory under European regulation on environmental accounts\nPhysical flow accounts for water and physical flow accounts for solid waste are for these time optional, we do not have established it. Most recently data for the reference year 2017 are still in the validation process by Eurostat
sources: Statistical Office of the Slovak Republic, Tourism Satellite Account of the Slovak Republic 2005-2016

footnotes: The first TSA for Botswana was for 2005/06 2. Tables 3 was estimated using the Bank of Botswana (Central Bank) Travel and Transportation Account, while Table 7 was estimated using the Statistics Botswana (CSO) Formal Sector Employment Survey. Botswana through the Wealth Accounting & Valuation of Ecosystems (WAVES) under the World Bank is in the process of implementing Natural Capital Accounting program using the SEEA. Four key sectors have been prioritized i.e minerals,energy, water and Land & Ecosystem including Tourism.
sources: Ministry of Environment, Wildlife and Tourism, Statistics Botswana - Botswana TSA reports

footnotes: TSA-table 1 and 2 is not divided into overnight visitors and same-day visitors. Only total is recorded. TSA-table 2 is not divided into domestic trips and outbound trips. Parts of TSA-table 6 is recorded, e.g "Tourism share (in value)" by tourism industry for variables total production, total intermediate consumption, total gross value added, compensation of employees, taxes and gross operating surplus. TSA-table 7 is not divided into employees and self-employed and number of establishments is not reccorded. Number of employed is reccorded, not number of jobs. Water accounts are to be developed during 2019 - they are intermittently published. A test of using SEEA within the TSA framework was done during 2018 and published: https://www.scb.se/contentassets/e5cd0bc363124d99a2c1b3cda18a8117/mi1301_2016a01_br_mi71br1802.pdf

But now we try to make TSA-SEEA in term of regional level because of the available data, size of areas and the technical guidance. Now we collaborate with UNESCAP, Thailand National Statistic Office (NSO) and National Science and Technology Development Agency (NSTDA) to study and establish the ocean accounts - tourism sector from the guidlines of SEEA. Now it is the pilot test to work on in regional level of Andaman Sea (5 provinces in the southern part of Thailand: Phuket, Krabi, Phang nga, Trang and Satun)

footnotes: TSA tables for 2017 will be released in November 2019; TSA tables for 2018 will be released in 2020. 2015 TSA data was revised and published at the same time as the 2016 publication. As a result of improvements to the methodology a 15% increase was observed in the levels of visits reported by respondents. Prior to 2008, air emissions accounts are available from 1995 onwards and water accounts are available for 2007. 2017 accounts for air emissions and energy will be released in 2019; waste accounts for 2018 will be available in 2020.

goal_descEN: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
target_descEN: Develop and implement tools to monitor sustainable development impacts for sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products
indicator_descEN: Number of sustainable tourism strategies or policies and implemented action plans with agreed monitoring and evaluation tools
seriesDescription: Implementation of standard accounting tools to monitor the economic and environmental aspects of tourism (SEEA tables)
footnotes: In 2009, the first Tourism Satellite Account exercise was presented based on the COU 2005. Based on that, the projections for each year are made using price and physical volume indices. The Central Bank of Uruguay is about to publish the COU 2012 so we have updated the first three tables to 2012 and we are waiting for the new information for the tables of production and internal consumption\nRegarding the environmental accounts Uruguay only has the Agricultural Sustainability Account, but a battery of sustainable tourism indicators has been designed that will be applicable from 2020
sources: Ministry of Tourism of Uruguay - Department of Research and Statistics and Central Bank of Uruguay
